pull.title: Reset setBlockIndexCandidates once block index db loaded
pull.body: Delete all entries in setBlockIndexCandidates that are worse than our new current block upon completion of the initial LoadBlockIndexDB.

events.body: Interesting; we should definitely do that. Can you move the logic for pruning setBlockIndexCandidates to a separate function (as the same code appears in ActivateBestChainStep)>
Aside from whitespace bugs, tested ACK only commithash ba5bf8f6ae344bf2e69ff551490b4262e3e9d129: http://bitcoin.ninja/TheBlueMatt-5194.txt

events.message: Reset setBlockIndexCandidates once block index db loaded

events.body: Removed the trailing whitespace on 2867 and 2869, as suggested.

comments.body: Nit: Please remove the trailing whitespace here and on 2869

Please check for end before dereferencing *it:

```
    while (it != setBlockIndexCandidates.end() && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(*it, chainActive.Tip())) {
```
It's just moved code, and shouldn't be necessary (see the assert that used to follow...). But this shouldn't hurt.
Well I prefer to be of the safe side. Wouldn't want to walk out of the set in case of a bug. But an assertion is fine with me too.
No, I agree it feels safer to have the condition. Without it, we wouldn't even reach the assertion before executing code with undefined behaviour (assuming the assertion wouldn't hold).
